title: Ticket #7363: SSL memory leak
description:
It appears we have a memory leak in the SSL code. Greg says:

It looks like guts inside an SSL CTX aren't getting free'd. I think the problem is near the end of condor_ssl_auth::authenticate, we do 

    X509 *peer = (*SSL_get_peer_certificate_ptr)(ssl);
    X509_NAME_oneline(X509_get_subject_name(peer), subjectname, 1024);
    setAuthenticatedName( subjectname );
    setRemoteUser( "ssl" );
    setRemoteDomain( UNMAPPED_DOMAIN );

    dprintf(D_SECURITY,"SSL authentication succeeded to %s\n", subjectname);

    (*SSL_CTX_free_ptr)(ctx);
    (*SSL_free_ptr)(ssl);

    free(buffer);
    return success;

From my reading of the openssl docs, SSL_get_peer_certificate increments a reference count, and the cert inside the SSL CTX (named ssl in this case) won't free the cert inside it when CTX_free is called. I think we need an X509_free(peer) call, like we do elsewhere.
